resources.string: Remove apps from recently used list
USB charging not supported. Use the supplied charger.
Allow application %1$s to access USB device?
Allow application %1$s to access USB accessory?
Open %1$s when this USB device is connected?
Open %1$s when this USB accessory is connected?
No installed applications work with this USB accessory. Learn more about this accessory at %s.
Use by default for this USB device
Use by default for this USB accessory
When an app was designed for a smaller screen, a zoom control will appear by the clock.
Unable to save screenshot. USB storage may be in use.
Unable to capture screen. DRM protected image.
Install Android file transfer application for Mac
Specified data usage limit reached. Additional data use may incur charges from service provider.
Connecting via packet data may incur additional charges. Continue?
Air gesture and TalkBack cannot both be turned on. TalkBack will be turned off.
Air view and the options below cannot both be on. The options below will be turned off.
Multi window and TalkBack cannot be turned on simultaneously. TalkBack will be turned off.
Smart pause and TalkBack cannot both be on. TalkBack will be turned off.
Smart scroll and TalkBack cannot both be on. TalkBack will be turned off.
Smart stay and TalkBack cannot both be on. TalkBack will be turned off.
Toolbox and TalkBack cannot be enabled at the same time. TalkBack will be disabled.

"Smart network helps to conserve battery life.
It turns off mobile data and Wi-Fi when the screen is turned off, so that the device consumes less battery.
However, you may receive cumulative push data when you turn on the screen."
Roaming will incur extra charges. Continue?
Connecting to mobile networks may incur extra charges depending on your data plan. Continue?
You will no longer be able to use applications such as Internet, Email, and YouTube via mobile networks. Continue?
Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection
Turn off the mobile data connection?

"Unless you connect to a Wi-Fi network, you will not be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."

Video calls will not work when mobile data is off. Also, you will not be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that need a data connection unless you connect to a Wi-Fi network. Turn off the mobile data connection?
Unable to turn off mobile data during VoLTE call.
Mobile data connection is currently turned off. You need to connect Mobile data to use data applications such as Browser, Email and YouTube via mobile network. Do you want to make the connection?
Unable to connect to mobile networks while Airplane mode is turned on. Turn off Airplane mode and try again.
Unable to connect to mobile networks while network restriction mode is turned on. Turn off network restriction mode and try again.
Unable to connect to Wi-Fi while network restriction mode is turned on. Turn off network restriction mode and try again.
The device will use data through the currently connected WLAN network.
WLAN is not available.Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
When this mode is turned on, notifications for selected features will be turned off. You will only receive notifications of incoming calls from people on your allowed list.

Blocking mode disables notifications for selected features. When incoming calls are blocked, you will only receive notifications of incoming calls from people on your allowed contacts. To change your Blocking mode settings, go to Settings > Personalization > Blocking mode.
When this mode is turned on, notifications for the selected features will be turned off.
To turn on Blocking mode, turn on at least one option below.
Hands-free mode must be turned off in Settings after you have closed S Voice Hands-free. If Hands-free mode remains on, notifications and incoming call info will still be automatically read aloud.
You can turn off Hands-free mode by saying “Turn off Hands-free mode” in S Voice Hands-free, or by going to Settings or the notification panel.
Insert SIM card to access network services.
Turning on Wi-Fi will turn off Portable Wi-Fi hotspot. Continue?
To turn on Power saving mode, turn on at least one function.
To turn on Hands-free mode, turn on at least 1 relevant function.
In Network restriction mode, you can use all your applications without connecting to the network. You can also receive calls and text messages. Network restriction mode will be turned on.
Network restriction mode will be turned off.
Unable to charge your device. Make sure that you are using a Samsung-compatible battery and charger, and that your device is properly connected to the charger.
Charging paused. Battery temperature too high.
Charging paused. Battery temperature too low.

"The device has stopped charging. The battery temperature is too high. Be careful when disconnecting the charger. It may be very hot.
Disconnecting and reconnecting the charger may allow charging to continue normally. If overheating persists, contact customer service as there may be a risk of fire or injury."
Connect to a power outlet to charge device and exit unused applications in Task manager. Continued usage while charging may prevent efficient charging.
Exit unused applications in Task manager. Continued usage while charging may prevent efficient charging.
If the battery drops below %d%% you will not be able to open Camera.
Unable to open Camera. Battery power is %d%% or less.
Wait until it has cooled down before using your device.
Switching from wireless charging to cable charging
Switching from cable charging to wireless charging
Your device is now charging wirelessly. The S Pen will not work within range of wireless charger.

The connected charger is incompatible with this phone. To prevent damage to your phone, charging has been stopped. To continue charging, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this phone.

The connected charger is incompatible with this tablet. To prevent damage to your tablet, charging has been stopped. To continue charging, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
Unable to charge. Use the original charger.
The connected charger will take longer to charge. To charge faster, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this phone.
The connected charger will take longer to charge or may not charge at all. To charge faster, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
To charge faster, use the original charger.
To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this phone.
To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.
For protection against water damage, firmly seal the charging cover before use.
Your phone is getting too hot. It will now turn off to cool down.
Your tablet is getting too hot. It will now turn off to cool down.
Why did my phone turn off by itself?
Why did my tablet turn off by itself?

"Your phone got too hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the phone.
Overheating can be caused by: - Using graphic-intensive apps like video games and navigation apps for long periods of time. - Downloading or uploading large files. - Using your phone in a very hot location."

"Your tablet got too hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the tablet.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics-intensive apps like video games and navigation apps for long periods of time. Downloading or uploading large files. Using your tablet in a very hot location."
Your device is overheating. It will now power off to cool down.

"Your device overheated. It powered off to prevent damage.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics-intensive applications, such as games and navigation applications, for long periods of time. Transferring large files. Using your device in a hot environment."
Your battery power is lower than the power sharing limit. To continue sharing power, adjust the power sharing limit to below the current battery power level.
Power sharing has ended. Disconnect the cable.
Smart stay cannot detect your eyes.
Device storage full. Delete some items.
After you put your device down, the screen will turn off.
Suppose you have missed calls or messages. Put down your device, then pick it up again when the screen has turned off.
Unable to start camera during call.
You have access to China Telecom WLAN network, consult 10000 to understand billing information, please turn off when not in use

By selecting this setting, you are allowing access to all location information by any third party through web access or any software or peripheral components you chose to install, download, add/or attach to the device or any other means. Turning on this functionality could pose certain risks to users of this device. Data usage will apply.

"Your phone can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping, and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you are considering to understand how they collect, use, and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."

"Your tablet can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping, and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you’re considering to understand how they collect, use, and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."
Turning on portable Wi-Fi hotspot will turn off Wi-Fi.
To turn on air view, turn on at least one function.
To turn on air view, turn on at least one function from the selected Air view mode.
To turn on air gesture, turn on at least one relevant function.
Press and hold a quick setting button to go to the relevant settings.
Reading mode has been turned on. The screen is now optimized for reading. This mode is only available in selected applications.
Automatic brightness settings are applied to the inner screen only.
Brightness adjusted manually. Auto brightness turned off.
Airplane mode allows you to turn off network features, including Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. To use Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, turn them on in Settings or the notification panel.
Airplane mode turns off calling, messaging, and mobile network functions.
Use one finger to pull down the status bar from the top of the screen.
Use two fingers to pull down the status bar from the top of the screen.
The quick setting panel is displayed.
Use two fingers to pull down one of the lists from the notification panel.
More information about the selected list is displayed.

Download large files (over %d MB) faster using Wi-Fi and LTE networks at the same time. Note that depending on the statuses of networks, Download booster may use only Wi-Fi or LTE networks to download files.

Download large files (over %d MB) faster using Wi-Fi and LTE networks at the same time. Note that depending on the statuses of networks, Download booster may use only Wi-Fi or LTE networks to download files.
Download booster will be enabled. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Wi-Fi is currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Mobile data is currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Wi-Fi and Mobile data are currently turned off. To enable Download booster, both Wi-Fi and Mobile data must be turned on. Downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Unable to use Download booster while roaming. We recommend downloading via a Wi-Fi network.
Turn on Wi-Fi and Mobile data
Unable to use Download booster while %1$s is on. Turn off %2$s and try again.
Unable to connect to mobile networks while Airplane mode is turned on. Turn off Airplane mode and try again.
Portable Wi-Fi hotspot consumes more battery power and increases your data usage. Continue?
Turning off Airplane mode will end your USB 3.0 connection and stop any ongoing data transfers.

"Your device is overheating. Steps will be taken to cool it down.
You can still use your device, but - the screen may get dimmer. - the device may slow down. - charging may pause.
Closing the current app will help cool down your device.
After the device cools down, performance will return to normal automatically."
Unable to open applications. You can only use the Phone and Contacts applications.
Unable to enable or disable %s while in Guest mode.
Do you want to restart your phone to turn off Safe Mode? All of your apps will be restored.
Tap to turn off Safe Mode.

"Your phone is getting too hot, so it's taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use your phone, but you may notice: - The screen might dim. - The phone might slow down. - Charging might pause.
After the phone cools down, performance will automatically go back to normal."

"Your tablet is getting too hot, so it’s taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use your tablet, but you may notice: The screen might dim. The tablet might slow down. Charging might pause.
After the tablet cools down, performance will automatically go back to normal."
Insert SIM card to use portable Wi-Fi hotspot and tethering.
Press and hold the recent key to view the menu.
The Menu key has been replaced by the recent key to allow you to quickly change between the applications you used most recently. Tap Help for more information.
While in an application, you can press and hold the Recent key to see menu options.
The Menu key has been replaced by the Recent key. Tap Help for more information.
The Menu key has been replaced by the Recent key to allow you to quickly change between the applications you used most recently.
The Menu key has been replaced by the Recent key. While in an application, press and hold the Recent key to see menu options.
To use Smart pause, enable Mute/pause first.
An SD card has been inserted.
